ygData.subject: Re: Rambling a bit, was: Re: [EQ_women] Marriage question......
ygData.msgSnippet: Salutations Sinrianna! You don t even want to know what I did last night with that quest. ... But maybe someone will get a laugh out of my stupidity. ... I
ygData.messageBody:
Salutations Sinrianna!

You don't even want to know what I did last night with
that quest.
:o)

But maybe someone will get a laugh out of my
stupidity.
:o)

I finally got together all the things I needed for the
tunic. I never did find the forest drakling scale but
I found someone who had one and offered to sell it to
me and asked what I would give them. I told them that
I didn't have any idea what anything cost but would
pay them whatever the fair price was. They told me
that they used to get 50pp but that they would sell it
to me for 20pp and that to be nice they would let me
have it for 10pp if that was all I could afford. Well
I had the 20pp and I didn't want to take advantage of
anyone so I gave it to them. (Yes, I'm a sucker)
:o)

Then I took all my stuff back to the Ranger guild
house and gave it to the Ranger who gave me the quest,
I forget the name. He took all the stuff, told me
thank you, and that was it. I didn't get anything, no
tunic, no exp., no nothing. I was so upset I didn't
know whether to laugh or cry . . .
:o)

So, after standing there for a long time kicking
myself I asked them for the quest all over again.
Oddly, this time they gave me the box to put
everything in and they also gave me a pattern for an
"enchanted tunic"? Not sure what that is all about as
there are not enough slots in the box to fit the stuff
and the tunic.
:o)

Anyway, I went back out and started gathering stuff
again. Still need to regain a couple items, including
that silly Forest Drakling Scale, but now I'm paranoid
about the exact approach to take to not lose
everything again. Apparently, I did or said something
wrong last time.
:o)

Oh well, live and learn I guess, but it certainly
didn't make me feel any better when I was telling
someone about the whole thing later and they told me I
had been ripped off on the price of the Forest
Drakling Scale . . . ouch!

Anyway, just thought I'd throw that out in case anyone
was interested at all.

:o)
Brangvyne
13th lvl Wood Elf Ranger

PS - I came across a master key in CB last night and I
have the two Orc eyes for the sword. For any more
experienced rangers out there, is there anything
special I need to do to give this to the Ranger in the
guild and actually get the sword instead of losing
that too.

--- Sinrianna Soulsteal <sinrianna@...> wrote:
>
> LOL ... someone in guild was just complaining about
> that earlier today :) ... they're a pain but, the
> newbie armor quests are worth it in the long run :)
> Have fun, and hunt safe ~
> Sinrianna Soulsteal
> Brangvyne Accampo <brangvyne7@...> wrote:PS -
> I never would have thought how much trouble it
> can be to find a pristine forest drakling scale.
> :o)
>
>
>
